title: WATCH LIVE | Gupta newspaper remains under spotlight at state capture inquiry
text:
WATCH LIVE | Gupta newspaper remains under spotlight at state capture inquiry

30 October, 10:46 AM

The state capture commission of inquiry will continue to hear testimony about The New Age (TNA) newspaper on Wednesday when Eskom's former divisional executive of corporate affairs, Chose Choeu, takes the stand for a second day.

On Tuesday, he told the inquiry that the power utility had entered into a sponsorship contract for the newspaper's business breakfasts without getting final approval from the sponsorship committee.

Choeu admitted that TNA's request for sponsorship had never been presented to the committee, nor was it assessed.

A former Eskom non-executive board member, Mark Pamensky, is also expected to take the stand.

Stream courtesy of SABC
description: The state capture commission of inquiry is expected to continue to hear testimony about Gupta-linked The New Age newspaper when Eskom's former divisional executive of corporate affairs, Chose Choeu, takes the stand for a second day.
